channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Coinbase calls PEPE a 'hate symbol,' prompting calls to boycott the exchange
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: An email newsletter sent out to Coinbase customers on May 10 caused significant backlash from the Pepe community.

item.title: To catch a scammer: Kraken builds fake crypto account to ‘bait’ fraudsters
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: A call-center scammer impersonating President Joe Biden attempted to steal what they thought was $450,000 worth of Bitcoin from a streamer — instead, chaos ensued.

item.title: Pepe’s market cap sinks $1B in 5 days, some whales are still buying
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: Pepe has witnessed a 56% decline over the past 5 days, wiping a billion dollars from its total market cap.

item.title: Robinhood's Q1 crypto revenue drops 30% from the previous year
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: The money coming in for the trading app's crypto business reached $38 million over the first quarter of 2023, down from $54 million in Q1 2022.

item.title: 3 takeaways from the European Union's MiCA regulations
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Guneet Kaur
item.description: The European Union’s Markets in Crypto-Assets regulation could stifle innovation and increase compliance costs for the crypto industry.

item.title: Kenya partners with Abu Dhabi's Venom Foundation to build blockchain, Web3 hub
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Hermi De Ramos
item.description: The blockchain and Web3 hub will serve as a center for knowledge exchange and collaboration between technology firms and government entities in Africa.

item.title: S&P Global attempts to assess crypto assets’ susceptibility to macroeconomics
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The ratings agency looked at five areas of interconnectedness between the crypto ecosystem and traditional finance; its lack of firm conclusions may be telling.

item.title: DCG settlement with Genesis still undecided as 30-day mediation period proceeds
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: The settlement plan proposed in February would give Genesis creditors 80% recovery of funds, but many raised demands, leading to the mediation.

item.title: OpenAI CEO to testify before Congress alongside ‘AI pause’ advocate and IBM exec
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tristan Greene
item.description: AI experts from IBM, NYU and OpenAI will testify before the U.S. Senate on May 16 in a hearing entitled “Oversight of A.I.: Rules for Artificial Intelligence.”

item.title: Tether has $1.5B in Bitcoin reserves: BDO Italia
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: The financial advisory and accounting firm also revealed that Tether held roughly $3.4 billion worth of precious metals.

item.title: IRS claiming $44B from FTX bankruptcy: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The single biggest claim involves unpaid partnership and income taxes of $20.4 billion assessed against Alameda Research.

item.title: Ethereum derivatives flirting with bearishness: Mind the $1,820 support
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: The failed rally above $2,000 on May 6 has proven that ETH bulls are nowhere near comfortable adding leveraged longs.

item.title: US lawmakers hold EU and UK as examples of crypto regulation in joint hearing
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: With the European Union coming closer to passing the Markets in Crypto-Assets framework and Kraken in the process of investing in the United Kingdom, lawmakers are taking notice.

item.title: Bitcoin Ordinals make their way to Binance: Nifty Newsletter, May 3–9
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: At the Metaverse Entertainment Worlds conference, Stephen Castell discussed how blockchain and AI are transforming ethics and banking.

item.title: Milady NFT floor price surges after Elon Musk tweet
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: Floor prices for the anime profile picture collection hit a high of 7.8 ETH after Musk's promotion.

item.title: $176M of Do Kwon's assets are frozen: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The frozen assets include an apartment complex, an officetel, several imported cars and various financial assets.

item.title: Arbitrum’s DAO to receive over 3,350 ETH in revenue from transaction fees
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Proceeds come from base fees and surplus revenue generated from network transactions. The incentive follows a recent clash between Arbitrum’s team and its community.

item.title: What is Google’s Bard, and how does it work?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Emi Lacapra
item.description: Following ChatGPT’s success, Google released its AI chatting service, Bard. Here’s all you need to know about the next generation of the AI-powered chatbot.

item.title: Here’s why crypto prices are down
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: On this week’s episode of The Market Report, Cointelegraph’s resident expert discusses why Bitcoin has been unable to break through the $29,000 level and why crypto prices have been falling.

item.title: Price analysis 5/10: BTC, ETH, BNB, XRP, ADA, DOGE, MATIC, SOL, DOT, LTC
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rakesh Upadhyay
item.description: Bitcoin and select cryptocurrencies are trying to start a rebound following the CPI data release, but bulls may find it difficult to continue the recovery at higher levels.

item.title: Bitcoin cracks $28K on CPI amid warning US inflation ‘highly elevated’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin joins altcoins in reacting strongly to CPI data coming in below estimates, with BTC price clawing back ground toward $30,000.

item.title: ParaSpace team clashes with CEO over alleged whereabouts of protocol funds
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: Protocol developers demand that CEO and chief technology officer Yubo Ruan step down, while Ruan has accused the development team of an “illegal takeover.“

item.title: PEPE vs. DOGE: How the memecoins performed their first time hitting a $1B market cap
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: In a recent Cointelegraph Twitter poll, DOGE was voted as the memecoin that will have had the largest market capitalization by 2025, with PEPE coming in second place.

item.title: Pepe sans crypto: Mods purge crypto from the original meme subreddit
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: After the explosion in popularity of the Pepe memecoin, moderators on the original Pepe the Frog subreddit felt the pressure to lay down the law.

item.title: William Clemente III tips Bitcoin will hit six figures toward end of 2024: Hall of Flame
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.description: Will Clemente III ditched school to become a crypto analyst and says Bitcoin has a strong chance of hitting six figures toward the end of 2024.

item.title: Why Web2 companies fail in Web3 while others made it
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arvin Khamseh
item.description: Web3 is now becoming the norm of this new era and therefore, a flurry of Web2 companies and venture capital firms are investing heavily in Web3 to avoid falling behind.

item.title: Discovering product-market fit and dynamic use cases for crypto
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Megan Nyvold
item.description: Be realistic with growth goals, embrace opportunities to change and listen to those willing to embrace trying these new products to maximize growth.

item.title: Bitcoin trading up 80% at DBS Bank due to crypto crashes in 2022, says exec
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: DBS Bank’s crypto trading platform has been attracting more institutional investors due to crypto exchanges that collapsed last year.

item.title: Mutual aid, DAOs and activism: The Agenda podcast chats with PactDAO co-founder Marisa Rando
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ray Salmond
item.description: PactDAO co-founder Marisa Rando says the decentralization of mutual aid collectives is key to catalyzing activism and building stronger communities.

item.title: Ethereum validators earn a record $46M as staking rewards rate surges
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: Ethereum’s staking rewards hit a record 8.6% post-Merge, with validators earning $46 million in the first week of May, citing the memecoin craze responsible.
